cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 370 miles ESE of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: tracking west-northwest along or just north of Cuba, near the Florida Keys Saturday, then turning northwest up the eastern Gulf toward the Florida Big Bend / eastern Panhandle
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend / eastern Panhandle coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Southwest coast of Florida from Englewood south and east to Ocean Reef, including Florida Bay
weather_observation.warning_coast: Florida Keys west of Ocean Reef to the Dry Tortugas, including Florida Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Eastern and central Cuba, the Bahamas, Florida Keys, southwest and west coast of Florida, Florida Big Bend, northern Gulf Coast
weather_observation.wind: Intermittent tropical-storm-force gusts (35–40 mph) possible Saturday as the center passes to the south-west.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None — surge threat confined to the Gulf side of Florida.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands could drop 3–7 inches with isolated 10-inch amounts, producing localized flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along the southeast Florida beaches.
